issue.title: atlas_sim_interface_state needs timestamp (to debug bursty comms)

content.raw:
there is some documentation on [transport hints on ros.org](http://www.ros.org/wiki/roscpp/Overview/Publishers%20and%20Subscribers#Transport_Hints).  Or see the [c++ api](http://www.ros.org/doc/api/roscpp/html/classros_1_1TransportHints.html).  Basically,

  * `.unreliable()` implies UDP
  * `.reliable().tcpNoDelay(true)` means TCP but without Nagle's algorithm.

When multiple hints are chained, higher preference is given to the left most option.  So something like `.unreliable().reliable().tcpNoDelay(true)` means UDP is preferred, in the case UDP is not available, try `TCP` with `TCP_NODELAY` option.

You are right about the queue size, if we only care about the latest message, then size 1 is all that's needed.  If loss of message is not allowed, as in the case of synchronized control with timing guarantee on command latency, a large buffer is used to prevent message loss.
